document_data.name: Gargajaws
document_data.refs2e: {{Cite dragon annual/1997/The magic of Myth Drannor|91-92}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Gargajaws''''' was a powerful, destructive spell capable of causing incredible damage to structures.
document_data.Effects:
Upon casting the spell, a column of white flame rose from the caster's cupped palms for {{SI|60|feet|long=yes}}. The white flame split in three past that point, each flame forming into a shape akin to the clamlike, eyeless head of a beast; these jaws would then attack a target each within {{SI|80|feet|long=yes}}. Though they dealt no damage to living matter, they struck inanimate and undead matter with the force of a ''[[disintegrate]]'' spell, effectively taking a bite out of a {{SI|10|feet|long=yes}} cube.

Were there not enough room for the column to rise to its full height, a single head was created, but its bite could damage a volume spanning twice the usual area in each dimension.
document_data.Components: The spell called for [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components, but also required a series of material components, including a piece of ferrous material, a stone, and a shard, spar, or long rod of glass.
document_data.History: The elves attacking [[Mythanthar]]'s tower in {{yearlink|241}} employed this spell, amongst others.{{cite book/Elminster in Myth Drannor|296-297|15}}
